clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness and Safety of Amisulpride in Chinese Patients With Schizophrenia
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness and Safety of Amisulpride in Chinese Patients With Schizophrenia - A Prospective Open-Label Multicenter Study

brief_summary.textblock:
Primary Objective:
To evaluate the effectiveness of amisulpride in Chinese patients with schizophrenia
Secondary Objective:
To evaluate the overall safety of amisulpride in Chinese patients with schizophrenia.

detailed_description.textblock: The study duration by subject will include a 8-week treatment period with 3 follow-up visits.

secondary_outcome.measure: Early response rate (PANSS score reduced rate: at least 20%)
Positive and Negative Syndrome Scale (PANSS)-total score improvement

arm_group.description: Patients are treated with Amisulpride referring to the dosage and usage section in Chinese Solian® PI. Amisulpride dosage is adjusted based on individual response and reaches the sufficiency within 1 week

intervention.description: Pharmaceutical form: tablet Route of administration: oral
